msItem.note: Recto with the fibres, 4 a 1 r col. I 7 lines, col. II 3 lines; 4 a 2 r 17 lines; 4 b 3 r col. I traces of ink, col. II 10 lines, 4 b 4 r 20 lines; 4 b 5 r 13 lines; 4 b 6 r 13 lines; 4 b 7 r 6 lines; 4 b 8 r 7 lines; 4 b 9 r 6 lines; 4 b 10 r 2 lines; 4 b 11 r 2 lines
Fragments of the same roll as P. Tebt. II 677, PSI Inv. 3054 (1)-(23), P.Mil.Vogl. I. 16, and P. Carlsb. S.n.
According to A. Wifstrand the text shows similarities to Apollonios Mys
Cf. also P. Lund. inv. 111, not a fragment of the same roll as P. Lund. inv. 4 but very close to it in chronology, style and contents

origin.origPlace: Tebtunis, Polemonos meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt

provenance.p: Purchased in Berlin by Lund University Library in 1933, from prof. Carl Schmidt;Isabella Andorlini "Scavi e acquisti di papiri negli anni '30: il caso dei PLund" in Comunicazioni, Firenze 1995, Istituto papirologico G. Vitelli, p. 45-50

listBibl.bibl: P. Lund. I 6 Isabella Andorlini, Trattato di medicina su papiro, Istituto papirologico G. Vitelli, Firenze 1995, p. 20-23, 94-96 etc M P 2386; P. Collart, Revue de philologie, Series III, 13, 1939, p. 86-87; Marganne, M.-H., Inventaire analytique des papyrus grecs de mâdecine, Genàve 1981, Hautes âtudes du monde grâco-romain 12, p. 197-199, 223, 326; Aegyptus 35 (1955), p. 92-93; I. Andorlini, Graeco-Roman Fayum. Texts and archaeology, Proceedings of the Third International Fayum Symposion, Freudenstadt, May 29 - June 1, 2007, ed. S. lippert & M. Schentuleit, Wiesbaden 2008. p. 1-13
